reviews.text: I stayed here with a fairly large group from work, for a weekend (2 nights) pre Christmas shopping etc. The trip was excellent and the hotel was very much part of that overall experience.
reviews.title: City Garden - most definately

likes.liked: — Cleanliness of rooms and very good breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly staff at check-in and generally helpful at all times, excellent buffet breakfast. Free Internet point. Location was quiet, maybe a little bit out from Dam Square but easily accessible by tram and inexpensive.
reviews.title: very good for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the people in Amsterdam to be very friendy and helpful from the tram drivers to shop owners and practically everyone we met. We were all amazed.
reviews.title: small but a wonderful hotel

likes.disliked: — rooms could of been a bit bigger

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a beaufiful city with canals, cyclists and beautiful buildings. On one day we visited the Cathedral, Van Gogh museum, Anne Frank museum, took a boat cruise and a visit to the Irish pub.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We packed a lot into one day and still got to shop and visit the flower market the following morning before our flight back.
reviews.title: nice hotel

reviews.text: Stayed for two nights at the end of July. The room was clean and the staff friendly. The breakfast was excellent and varied. I was surprised it was included in the price. Overall excellent value. We would defineately stay there again.
reviews.title: Good value, great breakfast at City Garden Hotel

reviews.text: Location - Near Museums, tram stops, restaurants, elegant shops & park. Not far from a boat tour stop
reviews.title: Good value & location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Full buffet breakfast was great. Staff helpful. Computer in lobby with Free Internet access. Rooms are small but stylish. I got a good last minute deal at 60 E.
reviews.title: Nice location and good breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed at the Hotel City Garden for 3 nights and had a wonderful experience. As many others have said, the rooms are small but everything else was great (you aren't there to be in your room anyway!). The accommodations were clean and had everything we needed. The breakfast was excellent and had a great selection. The location was perfect as it is on a quiet little street next to a very nice shopping district and near the tram stop. We walked everywhere rather than taking the tram and the hotel was located close enough to everything to do so. We highly recommend Hotel City Garden.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Stayed at City Garden Hotel Amsterdam for 4 nights in April 08. Found it easy to get to via tram from railway station - not walking distance especially if you have luggage. Booked this hotel as wanted to be in a quieter area away from the red light district but close enough to walk/tram to all attractions. Hotel is in a quiet, upmarket part of the city close to a lovely park. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms are comfortable and clean but not huge. The buffet breakfast was excellent with lots of choice and as much as you want fresh food. The hotel is very close to all the museums and a nice walk or tram ride to the centre for all other attractions. Great peaceful base for exploring Amsterdam.
reviews.title: great wee hotel
1 star is even a bit generous
reviews.text: This hotel needs some major remodeling. Giving it 3 stars is way too much. 1 star is pushing it. The location is good and the staff are very friendly, however the rooms need some serious remodeling...

reviews.title: AMS Holland Hotel, in a word "DISCUSTING"!
reviews.text: As many of the other guests I talked to when I was there, we were discusted with the rooms. Our room had torn sheets, holes in the walls,rust around the sink and shower plugs, fur growing on the ceiling of the bathroom, filthy carpets and Rentokill mouse traps around the skirting boards. One couple we talked to had been bitten all night and couldn't sleep. We were very dissapointed and even rang our travel agent and tried to changed hotel but everything was fully booked, It was a Valentines holiday I booked and we had seperate beds, when I asked at reception if they would swap our rooms for a double they wasn't interested. I am going to complain in writing to my Travel Agent and accompany this with Photographs.

reviews.title: Absolutley disappointing
reviews.text: VALENTINES WEEKEND. Booked through Bridge Travel,found the room (twin) very cramped,very musty(damp) smelling. The Shower/Bathroom had mold all over the the ceiling and side walls,the wardrobe had pieces missing from it and the sink unit was leaning to one side.The Bedspreads had cigarette burns in them and the carpets where badly stained.There where Mouse Bait Traps on floor 2 where I counted 5 down one corridor.When I asked to be moved to another room I was told it was not possible as every room was full.If you are paying for Breakfast do not expect anything much better.For a Two**(star) Hotel it felt more like a Bedsit,very over rated I would give it -**(star).

reviews.title: Will visit again
reviews.text: For the price it charges the AMS Holland is definitely worth visiting again.It is clean and has good room service/tidying every morning.Breakfast is superb.Only drawback is the TV set is too low and pose a danger to those who are tall-room 158.Cheerio.

I would not have gone had I read these reviews however we found quite the opposite. Our room was a triple and was large, as large as a travelinn and well equipped too with tea and coffee making facilities. Our friends had a double which was small but functional.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.text: The breakfast was good and the staff friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Recommended by a fussy pair!

reviews.text: Only slight negative is one of our party was bitten badly and was told by the pharmacist it was bedbugs, could have been picked up at this hotel but nobody else was affected.
reviews.title: A Great Cheap Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would go back.
reviews.title: a rat in my room

likes.liked: — a rat in my room that woke me up ta 4 am and ate my chocolates is a good answer?
likes.disliked: — The rudeness of the manager, the rat in my room,...I want my money back

reviews.text: My friend and I stayed in Room 273 and found it to be clean and comfortable. Sheets and towels changed daily, room was sufficient size with tea making facilities replenished each day, breakfast was simple but very edible and the staff, although we didn't require much, were helpful! Internet access available, storage for baggage, definately would stay here again and worth the money. Located on a quiet street beside Vondelpark, PC Hoovestraat, with great shopping and trams. All pictures as per website.
reviews.title: Small room, nice breakfast.

reviews.text: I was a bit worried after booking this hotel to see the candid traveller photos. I am not bothered too much about the rooms, but I knew my friends would be.
reviews.title: Affordable, comfortable, friendly. Cheers!

likes.liked: — The staff (reception and domestic) and the rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived at the hotel the reception staff were very friendly and remained so throughout our whole stay. We had a laugh with them when calling up taxi's etc.
reviews.title: Small Doubles are Cupboards
Nice, friendly, affordable hotel
reviews.text: You can tell that the hotel has obviously just been renovated as the 2 rooms that we booked had all new carpets, bathroom, bed linen, TV etc.

reviews.title: Hotel City Garden
reviews.text: The bathrooms were tiny, I am not going to lie, but it was fine for me to have a shower in & brush my teeth in the morning.
Our rooms weren't together, but I don't think we put this down as a request, so I can't really comment.
reviews.title: Something out of a horror movie

reviews.text: We were initially in a triple room with a very tiny bathroom, but after complaining we were immediately moved to a much better room.
reviews.title: Great location.

likes.disliked: — Bathroom size and very very slow internet.

reviews.text: They should really do something about the sheets, since they all have holes.
reviews.title: very good service

reviews.text: But the location was great and the price so good that one could overlook these things.
reviews.title: What Garden?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very clean, nice hotel with an excellent staff. I lost my chain in our room but somebody from the staff found it and they shipped it for free; didn't even want to take the reward for the foundings. I would recommend this place to anybody while staying in Amsterdam. Btw. the hotel is actually very close to Van Gogh Museum and Rijksmuseum.
reviews.title: excellent hotel!, avoid booking through venere.com or easytobook.com

reviews.text: The hotel is in a good location at the bottom end of the PC Hoofstraat , so just a 10 minute walk to the Leidseplein and is in a quiet location. The room was clean although very warm - I had to put on the air conditioning...also - and I know Amsterdam hotel rooms are famously diminutive - the room was miniscule. Ok it was a single, but if rabbit hutches do it for you then this is just the place. I could easliy touch both sides of the room with at the same time with my arms outstretched. The upstairs rooms may be better. Having said this, the breakfast was good value and the staff polite and the shower room worked well - although no plug for some reason.
reviews.title: A Mouse Lived in a Windmill..............
what can i say
reviews.text: Our beds had lice in them. Were bitten all night. Had to get a lice cure when we got homr.

reviews.title: horrible experience
reviews.text: The address was on one of the most chic in Amsterdam, and the description published by the hotel boasted of many amenities. However, when my taxi arrived in the late evening, I realized immediately that I was going to be extremely disappointed. The carpet was frayed, the door sqeaked, and the receptionist was rude and untidy. If it was not for the time of evening, I would have left immediately. However, I did check in to a very small room with two uncomfortable beds. The bedspread had several cigarette burns, the towels were paper thin and the bed was lumpy. My goal was to endure the night and get out the first thing in the morning.

reviews.title: Wish I'd checked TripAdvisor first...
reviews.text: I discovered that AMS had another hotel about four blocks down toward the Concertgebouw. I inspected a room there and was pleased. It was twenty euros more but certainly worth it.

reviews.title: Better choose another hotel.
reviews.text: I would not recommend anyone staying in the AMS Holland as it is a dismal place to spend sixty nine euros. I felt dirty staying there even if it is just down the street from some of the most refined shops in the city.

reviews.title: clean and well located
reviews.text: I wish I'd checked here first before allowing a travel agent to book me into this dive. The location may be good, but the only good thing about the hotel itself is the door out of it.
On the plus side the free internet in the reception area was welcome, the breakfast was exstensive and tasty and the rooms had clearly been recently refurbished.
reviews.title: We'd stay there again
A mouse in our room!
reviews.text: On the minus side, the room was tiny, even though we were booked in a 'standard' room and not the 'small' room situated in the basement, I dread to think how small that one is! Also on the minus side, the hotel was still having renovations carried out (we were not told this when booking) and a workman started drilling at ten past eight one morning.
The efficient reception staff were helpful with questions and there is a standard tourist information rack filled with details of things to do in Amsterdam.
reviews.title: A nice little hotel
